name: Transport feature types
definition: The Transport Foundation Theme is a suite of road, rail, air and maritime transportation networks and related infrastructure, including connections between the different networks.

concepts.name: Abstract Transport Type
concepts.definition: Abstract parent class for Feature Types that holds common attributes.

concepts.name: Access Restriction
concepts.definition: A restriction on the access to a transport element.

concepts.name: Accident
concepts.definition: An accident that happened on a transport element.

concepts.name: Bridge
concepts.definition: A structure that connects two locations and provides for the passage of a transportation route (for example: a road or a railway) over a terrain obstacle (for example: a waterbody, a gully, and/or a road).

concepts.name: Culvert
concepts.definition: An enclosed channel for carrying a watercourse (for example: a stream, a sewer, or a drain) under a route (for example: a road, a railway, or an embankment).

concepts.name: Engineering Structure
concepts.definition: Abstract Feature class used to describe common attributes for engineering structures e.g. tunnels, bridges, retaining walls.

concepts.name: Fence
concepts.definition: A barrier, railing, or other upright structure, typically of wood or wire, enclosing an area of ground to prevent or control access or escape.

concepts.name: Maintenance Authority
concepts.definition: The authority responsible for maintenance of the transport element.

concepts.name: Marker Post
concepts.definition: Reference marker placed along a route in a transport network, mostly at regular intervals, indicating the distance from the beginning of the route, or some other reference point, to the point where the marker is located.

concepts.name: Owner Authority
concepts.definition: The authority owning the transport element.

concepts.name: Restriction For Vehicles
concepts.definition: Restriction on vehicles on a transport element.

concepts.name: Retaining Wall
concepts.definition: A wall that holds back earth.

concepts.name: Transport Area
concepts.definition: Surface that represents the spatial extent of an element of a transport network.

concepts.name: Transport Link
concepts.definition: A line that describes the geometry and connectivity of a transport network between two points in the network.

concepts.name: Transport Link Sequence
concepts.definition: A line which is composed of an ordered collection of transport links, which represents a continuous path in the transport network without any branches.

concepts.name: Transport Link Set
concepts.definition: A collection of individual transport links that has a specific function or significance in a transport network.

concepts.name: Transport Node
concepts.definition: A point which is used for connectivity.

concepts.name: Transport Property
concepts.definition: A reference to a property that falls upon the network. This property can apply to the whole of the network element it is associated with or - for lines - be described using linear referencing.

concepts.name: Tunnel
concepts.definition: An underground passage that is open at both ends and usually contains a land transportation route (for example: a road and/or a railway).

concepts.name: Airport
concepts.definition: A defined site on land or water (including any buildings, installations and equipment) intended to be used either wholly or in part for the arrival, departure and surface movement of aircraft and/or helicopters.

concepts.name: Airport Area
concepts.definition: A defined area on land or water (including any buildings, installations and equipment) intended to be used either wholly or in part for the arrival, departure and surface movement of aircraft and/or helicopters.

concepts.name: Control Tower
concepts.definition: A tall building at an airport from which the movements of air traffic are controlled.

concepts.name: Seaport
concepts.definition: A point which is used to represent a sea port in a simplified way, approximately located at the bank of the waterbody where the port is placed.

concepts.name: Seaport Area
concepts.definition: An area which is used to represent the physical limits of all the facilities which constitute the terrestrial zone of a sea port.

concepts.name: Design Speed
concepts.definition: The specification of the maximum speed to which a railway line is designed for.

concepts.name: Metro Line
concepts.definition: A collection of metro link sequences and or individual metro links that are characterized by one or more thematical identifiers and/or properties.

concepts.name: Metro Link
concepts.definition: The centerline of a railway used by the Metro.

concepts.name: Metro Link Sequence
concepts.definition: A linear Feature composed of an ordered collection of metro links, which represents a continuous path in a metro network without any branches. The element has a defined beginning and end and every position on the metro link sequence.

concepts.name: Metro Node
concepts.definition: A point Feature which represents a significant point along the metro network or defines an intersection of metro tracks used to describe its connectivity.

concepts.name: Metro Station
concepts.definition: A metro station is a type of railway station that is part of a metro, rapid transit system, subway or underground railway line or railway network. Geometry representation of metro station is a center point.

concepts.name: Metro Station Area
concepts.definition: A metro station is a type of railway station that is part of a metro, rapid transit system, subway or underground railway line or railway network. Geometry representation of metro station area is an extent.

concepts.name: Railway Area
concepts.definition: Surface occupied by a railway track, including ballast.

concepts.name: Railway Line
concepts.definition: A collection of railway link sequences and or individual railway links that are characterized by one or more thematical identifiers and/or properties.

concepts.name: Railway Link
concepts.definition: A linear Feature that describes the geometry and connectivity of a railway network between two points in the network.

concepts.name: Railway Link Sequence
concepts.definition: A linear Feature composed of an ordered collection of railway links, which represents a continuous path in a railway network without any branches. The element has a defined beginning and end and every position on the railway link sequence is identifiable with one single parameter such as length. It describes an element of the railway network, characterized by one or more thematical identifiers and/or properties.

concepts.name: Railway Node
concepts.definition: A point Feature which represents a significant point along the railway network or defines an intersection of railway tracks used to describe its connectivity.

concepts.name: Railway Station
concepts.definition: The location of a railway station along the railway network.

concepts.name: Railway Station Area
concepts.definition: An area Feature which is used to represent the topographical limits of the facilities of a railway station (buildings, railway yards, installations and equipment) devoted to carry out railway station operations.

concepts.name: Advertisement Sign
concepts.definition: Advertisement or sign that is visible from a street, road or public place or by passengers carried on any form of public transport.

concepts.name: Black Spot
concepts.definition: A place where road traffic accidents have historically been concentrated.

concepts.name: Bollard
concepts.definition: A short post used to prevent traffic from entering an area.

concepts.name: Bus Route
concepts.definition: The route regularly followed by a passenger bus.

concepts.name: Bus Route Link
concepts.definition: A linear Feature that describes the geometry and connectivity of a bus network between two points in the network.

concepts.name: Bus Route Link Sequence
concepts.definition: A linear Feature composed of an ordered collection of bus route links, which represents a continuous path in a bus route network without any branches. The element has a defined beginning and end and every position on the bus route link sequence.

concepts.name: Bus Station
concepts.definition: A place in a town where buses arrive and depart.

concepts.name: Bus Stop
concepts.definition: Designated place where buses stop for passengers to board or alight from a bus.

concepts.name: Carriageway Link
concepts.definition: A linear Feature that describes the geometry and connectivity of a carriageway network between two points in the network.

concepts.name: Carriageway Node
concepts.definition: A point Feature that is used to represent connectivity between two carriageway links.

concepts.name: Form Of Way
concepts.definition: A classification based on the physical properties of the RoadLink.

concepts.name: Fuel Station
concepts.definition: An establishment beside a road selling fuel for motor vehicles, may also be called a petrol or gas station.

concepts.name: ITS Screen
concepts.definition: A screen used to show how different networks of transport are linked with each other.

concepts.name: Parking Pay Station
concepts.definition: A device used to collect money in exchange for the right to park a vehicle in a particular place for a limited amount of time, includes parking meters.

concepts.name: Pathway
concepts.definition: A way beaten, formed, or trodden by the feet of persons or animals.

concepts.name: Pedestrian Area
concepts.definition: Paved, tiled, or otherwise hardened surface intended for pedestrians only.

concepts.name: Road
concepts.definition: A collection of road links that are characterized by one or more thematic identifiers and/or properties.

concepts.name: Road Area
concepts.definition: Surface which extends to the limits of a road, including vehicular areas and other parts of it.

concepts.name: Road Edge
concepts.definition: The edge of a pavement that is nearest to the road.

concepts.name: Road Furniture
concepts.definition: Road Furniture includes all fixtures in the road and road reserve. The term includes fixtures on the road, for example, signs, traffic lights or advertisementSign.

concepts.name: Road Island
concepts.definition: Non-pedestrian islands in the road surface, such as center island, roundabout, etc. Often contains grass, trees, flowers or sculptures.

concepts.name: Road Lane Link
concepts.definition: A linear Feature that describes the geometry and connectivity of a road lane network between two points in the network.

concepts.name: Road Lane Node
concepts.definition: A point that is used to represent connectivity between two road lane links.

concepts.name: Road Link
concepts.definition: A linear Feature that describes the geometry and connectivity of a road network between two points in the network.

concepts.name: Road Link Sequence
concepts.definition: A line composed of an ordered collection of road links, which represents a continuous path in a road network without any branches. The element has a defined beginning and end and every position on the road link sequence.

concepts.name: Road Node
concepts.definition: A point that is used to represent connectivity between two road links.

concepts.name: Road Service Area
concepts.definition: Surface annexed to a road and devoted to offer particular services for it (e.g. fuel station, rest area, toll area).

concepts.name: Road Shoulder
concepts.definition: A shoulder, or hard shoulder is an emergency stopping lane by the verge of a road or motorway, on the right in countries which drive on the right.

concepts.name: Road Sign
concepts.definition: A sign near a road that has information for drivers.

concepts.name: Speed Limit
concepts.definition: Limit for the speed of a vehicle on a road.

concepts.name: Street Light
concepts.definition: A light illuminating a road, typically mounted on a tall post.

concepts.name: Taxi Station
concepts.definition: A place where taxis may park while awaiting hire.

concepts.name: Traffic Camera
concepts.definition: A video camera which observes vehicular traffic on a road.

concepts.name: Traffic Counter
concepts.definition: A device, often electronic in nature, used to count, classify, and/or measure the speed of vehicular traffic passing along a given roadway.

concepts.name: Traffic Light
concepts.definition: A set of automatically operated coloured lights, typically red, amber, and green, for controlling traffic at road junctions, pedestrian crossings, and roundabouts.

concepts.name: Underpass
concepts.definition: A road or pedestrian tunnel passing under a road or railway.

concepts.name: Weigh Station
concepts.definition: A place near a road where vehicles, especially large trucks, can be weighed.
